author: Guest (Guest)
title: Ubuntu on the Samsung Chronos 700Z7C-S02
text:
I just bought the Samsung Series 7 Chronos 700Z7C-S02. It comes with the Optimus graphics (Intel HD 4000 and a 1GB nVidia 650m).

The main reason I can't use Ubuntu 12.10 on the 700Z7C at the moment is because of the fan noise - one of the cores on the i7 is being thrashed (constantly sitting at around 80%) which results in the fans whirring away at full blast (this still isn't loud). This is a known issue, something to do with the phc-intel kernel module. Details of the bug can be found here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/887793

To get the keyboard backlight working, I followed the instructions here:

http://forum.notebookreview.com/samsung/673525-keyboard-backlight-ubuntu-12-04-chronos-7-np700z7c.html

I really hope the phc-intel kernel module problem is fixed soon, it's a blocker for me at the moment (I don't like putting this beautiful laptop under a constant stress test).

Oh, on another note, I was pleasantly surprised by the Intel HD 4000 on-chip graphics with Linux! Everything just worked with a fresh Ubuntu 12.10 install, including the mini DisplayPort and a secondary monitor running at 2560 x 1440. Dragging windows around is pixel perfect (very smooth). I look forward to using Ubuntu 12.10 (or better still, Elementary OS Luna) as the primary operating system on this beautiful laptop.

author: Guest (Guest)
title: Re: Few Questions
text:
Hello Jayneil,

1. I cannot answer you that
2. The fan is almost on because people dont install the AMD graphics driver. Installing them makes the laptop quite.
3. Currently there are limitations in X11. Hot swap is not supported. But its currently being worked on [see http://airlied.livejournal.com/]. But as I see that the laptop battery will last longer when using the dedicated graphics card as it underclocks itself when not used. Using the RC6 powersave modes for the integrated intel card makes you save more power. Because currently the intel uses more power when rc6 is activated and the card is used but less when its idling.
